name: (3-nitrophenyl)[(5E)-4-phenyl-5-(phenylhydrazono)-4,5-dihydro-1,3,4-thiadiazol-2-yl]methanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1056
Reason: 3-Nitrophenyl group: The nitro functional group can increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10°C. Phenyl group (2 phenyls): The two phenyls can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. 1-methyl-4-phenyl-1,3,5-thiadiazol-2-one: The methyl group can lower the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around -10°C. The phenyl group can also increase the melting point due to the ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The thiadiazole ring itself can also contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C.
